ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Given the nature of the class, I massively improved my writing skills. Even though the class is focused on creative writing class, I improved my skills across the board. It changed my perception of the practice of writing; it is as much an art as it can be a mechanical process. Through the way Professor Green taught us to read the essays, it was only possible for us to start picking up on the tried and true techniques that would improve our writing. Amazing class. I also really improved my public speaking skills in discussion. I was forced to organize my ideas into more concise and eloquent passages that were more effective in getting my point across.
Good readers make good writers; emulation; crafting the essay using structure, tone, and set-payoff techniques; deliberate eye for identifying what makes a work effective. Big toolkit!
I have learned how writing essays can be a culmination of structure and creativity and, in having such a combination, can yield a moving essay.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strengths are all in the actual format of the class yielding very real results. The constant writing and feedback mechanism made it very clear to us how to work with the suggestions we were given to improve our writing. The workshops are also extremely valuable. I don't know how I would improve this class.

Strengths very intellectually diverse students and works produced; essay workshop is very helpful and engaging for everyone! 
Weaknesses faster feedback could be better! So can go through more iterations.
The strengths of this course include the open, conversation-based setting and constant feedback from the professor. I do not see any obvious weaknesses in this class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I already have. It is not only effective but super fun as well. The format of the class yields real results, and it does so in a way that does not feel daunting.

Highly everyone has something to gain from this course. It equips you with a toolbox for writing well in contexts far beyond creative nonfiction writing. Each student needs to look inward to pull out their writing in ways that are often uncomfortable. Yet it gives closure to the loose ends of emotional experiences and also brings out the best insights and often times, humor. Really shapes you as a human being and reading peers' and professionals' essays shed so many new perspectives.
I would. The clear feedback and open conversation makes the course a great learning opportunity for all students.
